intro: Orthosia florida, commonly known as the Florida orthosia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly rough texture. Orthosia florida thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
